item.title: Urgent: Dead Animals (rats&squirrels)Found Near Toilets Placement Site (Romans Road & Grove Road), 27th August
item.description:
Dear team , I am writing to report a concerning situation in the area of the recent All Points Festival. Specifically, I have observed multiple dead animals (like rats and squirrels) at the location where the toilets were placed during the festival, near the roundabout between Romans Road and Grove Road, opposite St Barnabas Church. The first sighting was last week, and again today more dead animals were present. This raises concern that something toxic may have been left behind, or that the animals were exposed to harmful substances. This poses a potential health risk to both pets and children in the area, and I believe it requires urgent investigation and clean-up. Could you please arrange for an inspection and appropriate action to ensure the area is safe? Thank you for your prompt attention. Sincerely

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollards down again at Halliwick Rec entrance, 27th August
item.description:
Both bollards at the entrance to Halliwick Rec in N10 1AG are down again, giving easy access to travellers, which is a bit of a concern when they have only just been moved on from the playing fields next to Coldfall Woods last week, with their caravans and their horses. My husband has managed to wedge one of them up with a piece of metal as shown in the photo, and another with a stick to try and ward travellersâ€™ vehicles off, but these probably wonâ€™t hold for very long. It would be a shame if they got in and ruined the nice new park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Avenue, Colney Hatch, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheelie bin full of oil left in alleyway, 27th August
item.description:
Reported yesterday. Emailed to Sat it was resolved by bin is still there. Wheelie bin full of oil has been dumped next to commercial bins. Very dangerous to passing pedestrians and risk of spillage.
